name: Auto CBC - Create CBC Character Sheets from Text
author: DoesntPlayAnymore

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content:
Project link: https://neverwintervault.org/project/nw ... heets-text
SpoilerThis program takes properly formatted character builds and creates CBC Character Sheets for them. The CBC (Kamiryn's Character Build Calcuater, get it at (link is external)) to create sophisticated and sometimes very complicated builds where getting every level right is essential to the build. Users will upload text versions (output from CBC) to the forum where the builds are tested and critiqued. With this tool, it is now trivial to scrutinize builds in the CBC without the tedious process of manually having to enter hundreds of skill points, feats etc.
How it works:
  1. Download and extract autocbc.zip .
  2. In the extracted folder should be:
    autocbc.exe
    CBC.xlsx
    input
    output
     
  3. Place builds in the input folder. For examples of properly and almost properly formatted builds, download the example_input.zip. All input files should end with ".txt"
  4. Run autocbc.exe. You will see a console window pop up telling you what is going on. When the program is done, it will say "press any key to continue..." 
  5. Created files are in the output folder. For examples of output, download the example_output.zip
Spoiler
Spoiler
  • But how does it really work?

  • Any bugs?
  • What builds are in the example_input.zip?



That's it, hope you all enjoy! Please report any bugs you may find back to me!

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content: @Stagmeister I just want to throw it out there that the program could be modified to generate valid ECB Guild Filter excel rows. Let me know if that would have any interest.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I am one of the few builders that do not use the CBC program DoesntPlayAnymore, I don't particularly like its output, but...

I do recognize hard work when I see it & I want to thank you for your contribution to the guild & its members for that.

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content:
@Valerfor Thank you very much. Actually, this thing is meant as a piece of a (hopefully) bigger puzzle. What I really want to do atm is generate custom class packages (you know, those useless things you select on character creation) from ECB builds for super easy and safe leveling with the "Recommended" button. The best way to ensure a builds integrity other than actually playing it is afaik the CBC. Maybe even a scary 'Fully Automatic Leveler' could be made with GUI automation 😬 (who would dare use such a thing, haha!). Then there is also scraping forums for builds to help with the archive.

I'm working on the internal build parser right now - I want it to parse damn near everything that smells like an NWN build, not just CBC output, that would not be very interesting. You're actually mentioned in my notes, there's the "CBC standard" and the "Valerfor standard" lol. Stag's build format is also a challenge - how the hell do you parse "Disc1,..."???. Getting the parser right could be a building block for some very interesting projects. The current version (0.1 alpha) is mostly a proof of concept.

And sick that you can make builds without the CBC - my head would explode!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Sorry I haven't come back to you earlier DPA - not had much opportunity, I'm afraid (real life can be a pain). As with Valerfor, I don't use the CBC, but that's probably as much about masochism as anything. I still quite like the pencils and paper set out before me and seeing what comes from them. That and I've never had much time for or interest in IT - much as I feel about plumbing or the internal combustion engine. Sorry about the Disc1 stuff and so on, I type everything in here direct, and typing "Discipline" 40 times is exceptionally boring for someone whose keyboard skills extend to 2 fingers on a good day.

However, your efforts are massively appreciated. Part of my witterings elsewhere were at least partially driven by thinking about Hip's filter and how to keep it updated without necessarily re-inventing it. I know I don't have the skills, but wondered if between your good self and Orion we might be able to harness the ability and enthusiasm. Perhaps honesty is not always the best policy, but we're all (well, mostly) stout hearts who feel a love for the game here, and if we can't trust fellow members with our thoughts, who can we trust?

If it's the sort of thing you might be interested in, please let me know. We've already come up with a name, and it would be a shame to waste it - how does "Magi of the Search" grab you?

Cheers

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content:
Stagmeister:
 Sorry about the Disc1 stuff and so on, 
Ha, I know I'm the maniac for wanting to parse builds written by humans, don't you be sorry! Besides, if everybody just posted CBC output writing a parser would be trivial - almost not worth doing, and not very fun. So thank you (and others) for making this particular project very challenging. Hey, at worst we can have a completely automated CBC-archive of Maximillian and Mick Dagger builds (which is not so bad when I think about it.)
Part of my witterings elsewhere were at least partially driven by thinking about Hip's filter and how to keep it updated without necessarily re-inventing it.
(...) If it's the sort of thing you might be interested in, please let me know. 
Just let me know what you want done and how and I'll look into it. I have 10 days of vacation left - I am spending every day on my hobbies and neglecting my gym membership.
We've already come up with a name, and it would be a shame to waste it - how does "Magi of the Search" grab you?
Uh... Ehm... Are you guys adament on the name? You know what... Whatever, the name is great. I just want to get started.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Thanks DPA! I think what we could do with is an updating of Hip's filter every year or two (to a certain extent it will depend on hos many builds are added - at all levels). All would need to conform to Kail's rules, of course. Hip was (probably still is) a very good person, who added anything that might have been missing and corrected any slips. Mick and Empyre may wish to take a similar line, but I'm getting butch here (as far as I can), and suggesting only those builds that have been fully tested etc should be included. Or they'll get moved to the Unfinalized Builds forum. The Stag has spoken.

I have no idea at all how this may be accomplished, and that's where you come in - and I really don't want to abuse your time (oh, all right, I do, but work-shmurk). Maybe we could pursue through PMs?

Oh, and what would you prefer: Hero Finder? Priest of the Ascendants? Bloke who Finds Stuff Out? Eric? All manner of things are do-able here...

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content:
(...)I'm getting butch here (as far as I can), and suggesting only those builds that have been fully tested etc should be included.
In that case, that could be only a handful of builds, right? That sounds more like detective work. If we're talking 20 - 40 builds that need to be added, some low-tier administration could be applied to avoid duplicated efforts but not much more. Sounds like mostly a busy day/afternoon if one knows what to add.

Idea: Maybe the builds to include could come from a community effort, sort of like the "Hall of Fame" thread that never really amounted to anything? But with strict rules for posting submissions and voting. Then we avoid Batman'ing every thread individually to see what builds have been tested; just make a stickied thread and give people a few months to vote for builds they want archived for the ages.  Repeat every year or two. At that point, no automation is really needed, imo. Every build can be added manually to the ECB Guild Filter excel file in a satisfying amount of time.

If you want me to make the judgement call, well... I don't think I'm qualified for that. I'm not a good player or builder and I certainly don't have any pedigree - I just appeared two weeks ago and started posting. I could put together a list of builds added the last [insert time range] that are not already in the filter, and then after you or the other admins/mods have approved, just add them manually.

I'm really just trying to get a sense of scale here. If we're talking hundreds, upon hundreds of builds to add or investigate, then yeah, that's not feasible to do without some level of automation.
Maybe we could pursue through PMs?
I wouldn't mind that, but maybe Empyre or Mick Dagger have something to contribute?
Oh, and what would you prefer: Hero Finder? Priest of the Ascendants? Bloke who Finds Stuff Out? Eric? All manner of things are do-able here...
Uhm, I don't know... "Doesnt Phind Anymore"? Maybe a title will come in time if I prove useful. :)

Lastly, are there any plans of linking the guild filter and legacy archives together? I really like the search feature of the archives and it's annoying having to look different places for builds. Just something I've been wondering.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Oh bollocks, another one who can do multiple quotes. Please forgive me my simplicity.

The thinking is that any "new" builds in the level 40/ 30/ 20/ Free forums should be included. It's not a qualitative judgement, other than the rules have been followed - and that's not just me being arsey - the point is that others should be able to pick up those builds and run with them, knowing their qualities and down-sides in advance. If there are issues with any of them, then the mods and admins (as obvious gods) can shift/ add to/ remove from/ delete them as appropriate (ain't power grand?). But we may miss a thing or two, so questions should rightly be asked. When I did Hip's grunt-work on the current filter it took 2 or 3 months (though he did a whole lot more), but that was starting from us having nothing. And of course at that time the Legacy/ WoG Archive hadn't been reactivated. If there is a way to merge the two, that would be stupendous, but I'd stand more chance of licking the Queen of England's ear than doing it.

Personally - and I haven't checked this with Mick or Empyre - I really don't like the collective idea for finalized builds. They are either finalized or they are not. People play in different styles, with different companions (or not), and in different environments. If a build works to whichever level, who are we to judge its efficacy? And if there are issues, they should come in the discussions about said build, which should then help anyone attempting to go on and play that build.

As far as PMs are concerned - as a god an admin, I can share them with Mick and Empyre (wouldn't want a mad Viking or Texan, or both, on my case, after all!), so that's not a concern.

Finally, take what name you're given and be grateful 😋

Cheers

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content: I'll get started in the morning, Captain.

Edit: methods listed for the tapatalk epic, mid epic and preepic build searches. so it can be replicated if needed, or comments on improvement can be made. Easiest to explain with a screenshot. Tapatalk requires keywords to be entered that is not too common. I used the numbers 20 (for level 20 builds), 30 (for level 30 builds) and 40 (for level 40 builds) as almost certainly any build would have that number in them. I used the letters 'AC' in addition as any build should have the AC listed in its build

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote: Heh, the real deal would be to parse the "unfinished section" & find all the builds in there from requests, challenge-threads, role-playing builds, etc. Then check who are good for posting in full epic section, pass those without a skill-schedule (mine don't have one, for example) into your new utility, reform them & finally post them anew. Tis a lot of work...Don't know, maybe I will give it a try, at least finding & pointing-out some of them, if you want.
Right now I'm doing everything by hand. Many of these builds would probably crash the parser (I know yours do wink wink). I'm strongly considering making a little tool just to quickly make the level spread, ending stats title and all that quickly, but since that will likely take an hour or more it's probably not worth it time wise.

I also think we should focus on the builds that we know are ready - basically all the ones @Orion2019 has posted. What are we talking, 20 - 30 builds? I'm already at number 7, so I think it's best just to get it done.

Addressing your idea specifically: Something like that could (and should imo) be done but I'd still have to make the parser more flexible and change the output - output is no big deal, flexible parser is. I've been thinking of making a "skill dumper" utility that automatically spreads skill points out from ending stats and class progression - that could probably be useful for that and in general. But I think that is something we should get back to.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Yeah, no-pressure, it isn't a priority or anything, merely an idea & of course I would also help myself with this.

One thing at a time.

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content:
Well that's a nice and simple one: it doesn't conform to the rules, so I'll shift it. 
Nice, thank you.
Mick tried to encourage standard presentation
Like, for instance... Hypothetically: Not writing "Armor Skin" as "Armour Skin", thereby forever shattering my dreams of making a reasonably simple, yet effective build parser? 🤔

The programming side of me loves Mick.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Ah, now, that all depends (for me, anyway) how Atlantic-friendly I'm feeling at the time. I remember a discussion with Hip about "Leveling" versus "Levelling" as well, and wielding the Oxford English Dictionary in my defence.

And what's not to love about Mick (apart from the recently discovered heightism and beardist tendencies and his always being right)?

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content:
And what's not to love about Mick (apart from the recently discovered heightism and beardist tendencies and his always being right)?
Can't say I disagree!

Anyway, done! I will make a thread for further discussion on the Soon-to-be ECB Guild Build Archive and in extension the ECB Guild Filter. (This thread used to be about a neat little utility I made, lol!)

E, new thread is here: viewtopic.php?f=18&t=2355126&from_new_topic=1

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
DoesntPlayAnymore wrote:...Not writing "Armor Skin" as "Armour Skin", thereby forever shattering my dreams of making a reasonably simple, yet effective build parser? 🤔
Ehm, Yeah, guilty as charged as well, I like my"extra" "o" sometimes...😊

In my defence defense, most of it has to do with what University one selected when they started learning English (Cambridge Vs Michigan). Well, their parents anyway.

In favo(u)r of consistency, I will try to abide by the rules from now & on. OR, just let Grammarly do the corrections for me probably. 😉

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Would (or should that be "wud" - and "shud", for that matter?) that be Cambridge, Massachusetts, or Cambridge, Cambridgeshire? Stuff it, I say. Let's keep the colour (which the spellchecker doesn't like either, of course) and anomalies intact! It both keeps DPA on his toes and still allows us to celebrate us all being able to communicate together wheresoever we are in the world - yet another reason for declaring NwN's greatness!

Score for variety! 😄

posts.author: DoesntPlayAnymore
posts.content: For real though, when I saw "Armour Skin"... That was the straw... I can take so much into account; abbreviations, random delimiters, epic dragon stats in the middle off the build(???)  etc. but if we're not even speaking the same language, ha! What can I even do!
